title: Cellluloid
brief_description: Celluloid was the first material used in the mass production of motion picture film. Made from highly flammable Cellulose Nitrate and prone to combustion when running through a projector, Celluloid was replaced in the 1950s by Acetate otherwise known as Safety Film.
